item.title: Canada announces new trade restrictions on China technology exports
item.description: Canada's government announced new export controls targeting advanced technology transfers to China, citing national security concerns. The restrictions follow similar moves by allies including the US and EU.

item.title: Beijing responds to Canadian diplomatic statements on human rights
item.description: China's foreign ministry spokesperson issued a formal response to recent Canadian parliamentary statements regarding human rights in Xinjiang, calling the remarks "interference in internal affairs."

item.title: European Central Bank holds interest rates steady
item.description: The ECB maintained its benchmark interest rate at 3.75%, signaling a cautious approach to monetary easing amid persistent inflation in the eurozone services sector.

item.title: Canadian canola exports to China reach five-year high
item.description: Statistics Canada data shows canola shipments to China surged 18% year-over-year, reaching $5.2 billion in the latest reporting period. The recovery follows years of trade tensions between Ottawa and Beijing.

item.title: PRC military exercises near Taiwan draw international concern
item.description: The People's Republic of China conducted large-scale military drills in the Taiwan Strait, prompting statements from the United States, Japan, and Canada expressing concern over regional stability.

item.title: UN climate talks progress in Geneva
item.description: Negotiators made incremental progress on loss and damage funding mechanisms at the intersessional climate talks in Geneva.
